citation.excerpt: ESRGAN: Enhanced Super-Resolution Generative Adversarial Networks
Source of original paper results: https://arxiv.org/pdf/1809.00219v2.pdf
If you find a bug, create a GitHub issue, or even better, submit a pull request. Similarly, if you have questions,
Xintao Wang, Ke Yu, Shixiang Wu, Jinjin Gu, Yihao Liu, Chao Dong, Chen Change Loy, Yu Qiao, Xiaoou Tang

description.excerpt: This repository contains an op-for-op PyTorch reimplementation of ESRGAN: Enhanced Super-Resolution Generative Adversarial Networks.
Modify the contents of the file as follows.
Modify the contents of the file as follows.
In the following table, the value in () indicates the result of the project, and - indicates no test.
I look forward to seeing what the community does with these models!

The Super-Resolution Generative Adversarial Network (SRGAN) is a seminal work that is capable of generating realistic 
textures during single image super-resolution. However, the hallucinated details are often accompanied with unpleasant 
artifacts. To further enhance the visual quality, we thoroughly study three key components of SRGAN - network
particular, we introduce the Residual-in-Residual Dense Block (RRDB) without batch normalization as the basic network
instead of the absolute value. Finally, we improve the perceptual loss by using the features before activation, which
the proposed ESRGAN achieves consistently better visual quality with more realistic and natural textures than SRGAN and
A simple implementation of esrgan, which uses the pytorch framework.

invocation.excerpt:
Download dataset 
Download train dataset 
Download val dataset 
Test (e.g Set5) 
Train (e.g DIV2K)

config.py line 38 mode="valid" change to model="train"; 
Run python train.py.

excerpt.body:
# ESRGAN-PyTorch 0.2.0 Release Notes

- New Features
- Bug Fixes

## New Features

**Add automatic mixed precision training**
It can save memory and speed up the training. Please refer to [https://pytorch.org/docs/stable/notes/amp_examples.html#amp-examples](https://pytorch.org/docs/stable/notes/amp_examples.html#amp-examples).

**Add support for distributed training**
Please refer to for more details [https://pytorch.org/tutorials/intermediate/ddp_tutorial.html](https://pytorch.org/tutorials/intermediate/ddp_tutorial.html).

**Automated data enhancement**
Please refer to for more details [https://github.com/kakaobrain/fast-autoaugment](https://github.com/kakaobrain/fast-autoaugment).

**Add test model performance function**
We used the Thop tool to calculate the complexity of the entire model and the inference time. More details see [https://github.com/Lornatang/ESRGAN-PyTorch#test-model-performance](https://github.com/Lornatang/ESRGAN-PyTorch#test-model-performance)

## Bug Fixes

- The definition of content loss is wrong. It should be `nn.L1Loss` instead of `nn.MSELoss`.
- Error in changing the definition of perceived loss.
- Fixed the problem of unable to read the video stream while inferring the video.
excerpt.name: For the most standard implementation of the model defined in the paper.
